BrainAlign.came.model.v0.base_layers moduleÔÉÅ

BrainAlign.came.model.v0.cgc moduleÔÉÅ

Created on Tue Mar 16 14:11:14 2021

@author: Xingyan Liu

class BrainAlign.came.model.v0.cgc.CGCNet(**kwargs)ÔÉÅ

Bases: CGGCNet

Cell-Gene-Cell graph neural network (used when features are 1-to-1 aligned)

Graph Convolutional Network for cell-gene Heterogeneous graph, with edges named as:

  • (‚Äòcell‚Äô, ‚Äòexpress‚Äô, ‚Äògene‚Äô): ov_adj

  • (‚Äògene‚Äô, ‚Äòexpressed_by‚Äô, ‚Äòcell‚Äô): ov_adj.T

  • (‚Äòcell‚Äô, ‚Äòself_loop_cell‚Äô, ‚Äòcell‚Äô): sparse.eye(n_cells)

Notes

  • gene embeddings are computed from cells;

  • weight sharing across hidden layers is allowed by setting share_hidden_weights as True.

  • attention can be applied on the last layer (self.cell_classifier);

  • the graph for the embedding layer and the hidden layers can be different.

Parameters:

  • g_or_canonical_etypes (dgl.DGLGraph or a list of 3-length-tuples) ‚Äì if provide a list of tuples, each of the tuples should be like (node_type_source, edge_type, node_type_destination).

  • in_dim_dict (Dict[str, int]) ‚Äì Input dimensions for each node-type

  • h_dim (int) ‚Äì number of dimensions of the hidden states

  • h_dim_add (Optional[int or Tuple]) ‚Äì if provided, an extra hidden layer will be add before the classifier

  • out_dim (int) ‚Äì number of classes (e.g., cell types)

  • num_hidden_layers (int) ‚Äì number of hidden layers

  • norm (str) ‚Äì normalization method for message aggregation, should be one of {‚Äònone‚Äô, ‚Äòboth‚Äô, ‚Äòright‚Äô, ‚Äòleft‚Äô} (Default: ‚Äòright‚Äô)

  • use_weight (bool) ‚Äì True if a linear layer is applied after message passing. Default: True

  • dropout_feat (float) ‚Äì dropout-rate for the input layer

  • dropout (float) ‚Äì dropout-rate for the hidden layer

  • negative_slope (float) ‚Äì negative slope for LeakyReLU

  • batchnorm_ntypes (List[str]) ‚Äì specify the node types to apply BatchNorm (Default: None)

  • layernorm_ntypes (List[str]) ‚Äì specify the node types to apply LayerNorm

  • out_bias (bool) ‚Äì whether to use the bias on the output classifier

  • rel_names_out (a list of tuples or strings) ‚Äì names of the output relations; if not provided, use all the relations of the graph.

  • share_hidden_weights (bool) ‚Äì whether to share the graph-convolutional weights across hidden layers

  • attn_out (bool) ‚Äì whether to use attentions on the output layer

  • kwdict_outgat (Dict) ‚Äì a dict of key-word parameters for the output graph-attention layers

  • share_layernorm (bool) ‚Äì whether to share the LayerNorm across hidden layers

  • residual (bool) ‚Äì whether to use the residual connection between the embedding layer and the last hidden layer. This operation may NOT be helpful in transfer-learning scenario. (Default: False)

See also

CGGCNet

training: boolÔÉÅ

BrainAlign.came.model.v0.cggc moduleÔÉÅ

Created on Sat Mar 20 18:59:29 2021

@author: Xingyan Liu

class BrainAlign.came.model.v0.cggc.CGGCNet(g_or_canonical_etypes: DGLHeteroGraph | Sequence[Tuple[str]], in_dim_dict: Dict[str, int], h_dim: int = 32, h_dim_add: int | None = None, out_dim: int = 32, num_hidden_layers: int = 1, norm: str = 'right', use_weight: bool = True, dropout_feat: float = 0.0, dropout: float = 0.0, negative_slope: float = 0.05, batchnorm_ntypes: List[str] | None = None, layernorm_ntypes: List[str] | None = None, out_bias: bool = False, rel_names_out: Sequence[Tuple[str]] | None = None, share_hidden_weights: bool = False, attn_out: bool = True, kwdict_outgat: Dict = {}, share_layernorm: bool = True, residual: bool = False, **kwds)ÔÉÅ

Bases: Module

Cell-Gene-Gene-Cell graph neural network.

Graph Convolutional Network for cell-gene Heterogeneous graph, with edges named as:

  • (‚Äòcell‚Äô, ‚Äòexpress‚Äô, ‚Äògene‚Äô): ov_adj

  • (‚Äògene‚Äô, ‚Äòexpressed_by‚Äô, ‚Äòcell‚Äô): ov_adj.T

  • (‚Äògene‚Äô, ‚Äòhomolog_with‚Äô, ‚Äògene‚Äô): vv_adj + sparse.eye(n_gnodes)

  • (‚Äòcell‚Äô, ‚Äòself_loop_cell‚Äô, ‚Äòcell‚Äô): sparse.eye(n_cells)

Notes

  • gene embeddings are computed from cells;

  • weight sharing across hidden layers is allowed by setting share_hidden_weights as True.

  • attention can be applied on the last layer (self.cell_classifier);

  • the graph for the embedding layer and the hidden layers can be different;

  • allow expression values as static edge weights. (but seems not work‚Ä¶)

Parameters:

  • g_or_canonical_etypes (dgl.DGLGraph or a list of 3-length-tuples) ‚Äì if provide a list of tuples, each of the tuples should be like (node_type_source, edge_type, node_type_destination).

  • in_dim_dict (Dict[str, int]) ‚Äì Input dimensions for each node-type

  • h_dim (int) ‚Äì number of dimensions of the hidden states

  • h_dim_add (Optional[int or Tuple]) ‚Äì if provided, an extra hidden layer will be add before the classifier

  • out_dim (int) ‚Äì number of classes (e.g., cell types)

  • num_hidden_layers (int) ‚Äì number of hidden layers

  • norm (str) ‚Äì normalization method for message aggregation, should be one of {‚Äònone‚Äô, ‚Äòboth‚Äô, ‚Äòright‚Äô, ‚Äòleft‚Äô} (Default: ‚Äòright‚Äô)

  • use_weight (bool) ‚Äì True if a linear layer is applied after message passing. Default: True

  • dropout_feat (float) ‚Äì dropout-rate for the input layer

  • dropout (float) ‚Äì dropout-rate for the hidden layer

  • negative_slope (float) ‚Äì negative slope for LeakyReLU

  • batchnorm_ntypes (List[str]) ‚Äì specify the node types to apply BatchNorm (Default: None)

  • layernorm_ntypes (List[str]) ‚Äì specify the node types to apply LayerNorm

  • out_bias (bool) ‚Äì whether to use the bias on the output classifier

  • rel_names_out (a list of tuples or strings) ‚Äì names of the output relations; if not provided, use all the relations of the graph.

  • share_hidden_weights (bool) ‚Äì whether to share the graph-convolutional weights across hidden layers

  • attn_out (bool) ‚Äì whether to use attentions on the output layer

  • kwdict_outgat (Dict) ‚Äì a dict of key-word parameters for the output graph-attention layers

  • share_layernorm (bool) ‚Äì whether to share the LayerNorm across hidden layers

  • residual (bool) ‚Äì whether to use the residual connection between the embedding layer and the last hidden layer. This operation may NOT be helpful in transfer-learning scenario. (Default: False)

See also

HiddenRRGCN

forward(feat_dict, g, **other_inputs)ÔÉÅ

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

BrainAlign.came.model.v0.cggc.detach2numpy(x)ÔÉÅ

BrainAlign.came.model.v0.heteroframe moduleÔÉÅ

Heterograph NN modules

class BrainAlign.came.model.v0.heteroframe.HeteroGraphConv(mods, aggregate='sum')ÔÉÅ

Bases: Module

A generic module for computing convolution on heterogeneous graphs.

The heterograph convolution applies sub-modules on their associating relation graphs, which reads the features from source nodes and writes the updated ones to destination nodes. If multiple relations have the same destination node types, their results are aggregated by the specified method.

If the relation graph has no edge, the corresponding module will not be called.

Examples

Create a heterograph with three types of relations and nodes.

>>> import dgl
>>> g = dgl.heterograph({
...     ('user', 'follows', 'user') : edges1,
...     ('user', 'plays', 'game') : edges2,
...     ('store', 'sells', 'game')  : edges3})

Create a HeteroGraphConv that applies different convolution modules to different relations. Note that the modules for 'follows' and 'plays' do not share weights.

>>> import dgl.nn.pytorch as dglnn
>>> conv = dglnn.HeteroGraphConv({
...     'follows' : dglnn.GraphConv(...),
...     'plays' : dglnn.GraphConv(...),
...     'sells' : dglnn.SAGEConv(...)},
...     aggregate='sum')

Call forward with some 'user' features. This computes new features for both 'user' and 'game' nodes.

>>> import torch as th
>>> h1 = {'user' : th.randn((g.number_of_nodes('user'), 5))}
>>> h2 = conv(g, h1)
>>> print(h2.keys())
dict_keys(['user', 'game'])

Call forward with both 'user' and 'store' features. Because both the 'plays' and 'sells' relations will update the 'game' features, their results are aggregated by the specified method (i.e., summation here).

>>> f1 = {'user' : ..., 'store' : ...}
>>> f2 = conv(g, f1)
>>> print(f2.keys())
dict_keys(['user', 'game'])

Call forward with some 'store' features. This only computes new features for 'game' nodes.

>>> g1 = {'store' : ...}
>>> g2 = conv(g, g1)
>>> print(g2.keys())
dict_keys(['game'])

Call forward with a pair of inputs is allowed and each submodule will also be invoked with a pair of inputs.

>>> x_src = {'user' : ..., 'store' : ...}
>>> x_dst = {'user' : ..., 'game' : ...}
>>> y_dst = conv(g, (x_src, x_dst))
>>> print(y_dst.keys())
dict_keys(['user', 'game'])
Parameters:

  • mods (dict[str, nn.Module]) ‚Äì Modules associated with every edge types. The forward function of each module must have a DGLHeteroGraph object as the first argument, and its second argument is either a tensor object representing the node features or a pair of tensor object representing the source and destination node features.

  • aggregate (str, callable, optional) ‚Äì

    Method for aggregating node features generated by different relations. Allowed string values are ‚Äòsum‚Äô, ‚Äòmax‚Äô, ‚Äòmin‚Äô, ‚Äòmean‚Äô, ‚Äòstack‚Äô. The ‚Äòstack‚Äô aggregation is performed along the second dimension, whose order is deterministic. User can also customize the aggregator by providing a callable instance. For example, aggregation by summation is equivalent to the follows:

    def my_agg_func(tensors, dsttype):
    # tensors: is a list of tensors to aggregate
    # dsttype: string name of the destination node type for which the
    #          aggregation is performed
    stacked = torch.stack(tensors, dim=0)
    return torch.sum(stacked, dim=0)

modsÔÉÅ

Modules associated with every edge types.

Type:

dict[str, nn.Module]

forward(g, inputs, etypes=None, mod_args=None, mod_kwargs=None)ÔÉÅ

Forward computation

Invoke the forward function with each module and aggregate their results.

Parameters:

  • g (DGLHeteroGraph) ‚Äì Graph data.

  • inputs (dict[str, Tensor] or pair of dict[str, Tensor]) ‚Äì Input node features.

  • mod_args (dict[str, tuple[any]], optional) ‚Äì Extra positional arguments for the sub-modules.

  • mod_kwargs (dict[str, dict[str, any]], optional) ‚Äì Extra key-word arguments for the sub-modules.

Returns:

Output representations for every types of nodes.

Return type:

dict[str, Tensor]

Hidden layers (not including the embedding layer)

class BrainAlign.came.model.v0.hidden.HiddenRGCN(canonical_etypes, h_dim: Sequence[int] | int = 32, num_hidden_layers: int = 2, norm: str = 'right', use_weight: bool = True, dropout: float | int = 0.0, negative_slope: float | int = 0.2, batchnorm_ntypes: Sequence[str] | None = None, layernorm_ntypes: Sequence[str] | None = None, share_layernorm: bool = False, bias: bool = True, activate_out: bool = True, **kwds)ÔÉÅ

Bases: Module

NOT sharing parameters across hidden layers

forward(g, h_dict, norm=True, bias=True, activate=True, **kwds)ÔÉÅ

No copies made for h_dict, so make sure the forward functions do not make any changes directly on the h_dict !

training: boolÔÉÅ
class BrainAlign.came.model.v0.hidden.HiddenRRGCN(canonical_etypes, h_dim: int = 32, num_hidden_layers: int = 2, out_dim: Sequence | int | None = None, norm: str | None = 'right', use_weight=True, dropout: float = 0.0, negative_slope: float = 0.05, batchnorm_ntypes: Sequence[str] | None = None, layernorm_ntypes: Sequence[str] | None = None, share_layernorm: bool = True)ÔÉÅ

Bases: Module

Stacked hidden layers sharing parameters with each other, so that the dimensions for each layer should be the same.

Parameters:

  • canonical_etypes (dgl.DGLGraph or a list of 3-length-tuples) ‚Äì if provide a list of tuples, each of the tuples should be like (node_type_source, edge_type, node_type_destination).

  • h_dim (int) ‚Äì number of dimensions of the hidden states

  • num_hidden_layers (int) ‚Äì number of hidden layers

  • out_dim (Optional[int or Tuple[int]]) ‚Äì if provided, an extra hidden layer will be add before the classifier

  • norm (str) ‚Äì normalization method for message aggregation, should be one of {‚Äònone‚Äô, ‚Äòboth‚Äô, ‚Äòright‚Äô, ‚Äòleft‚Äô} (Default: ‚Äòright‚Äô)

  • use_weight (bool) ‚Äì True if a linear layer is applied after message passing. Default: True

  • dropout (float) ‚Äì dropout-rate for the hidden layer

  • negative_slope (float) ‚Äì negative slope for LeakyReLU

  • batchnorm_ntypes (List[str]) ‚Äì specify the node types to apply BatchNorm (Default: None)

  • layernorm_ntypes (List[str]) ‚Äì specify the node types to apply LayerNorm

  • share_layernorm (bool) ‚Äì whether to share the LayerNorm across hidden layers

See also

GeneralRGCLayer

forward(g_or_blocks, h_dict, norm=True, bias=True, activate=True, **kwds)ÔÉÅ

No copies made for h_dict, so make sure the forward functions do not make any changes directly on the h_dict !
